avalancheActivity.comment: Wet-snow avalanches possible at any time or day or night, esp. at the foot of rock walls on the Italian border. Wet-snow avalanches can fracture down to ground level and grow to large size, esp. in zones with sufficient snow. Runout zones should be avoided. Unfavorable conditions for backcountry tours.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Naturally triggered wet-snow avalanches possible at any time or day or night

snowpackStructure.comment: Heavy rainfall is expected. Weather conditions are making the snowpack ever wetter, leading to a loss of firmness inside the snowpack.

tendency.highlights: Due to rainfall, frequency and size of danger zones are on the increase

weatherForecast.comment: On Wednesday, gray and wet weather anticipated. Dense clouds will accumulate. A bit of rainfall is anticipated. Southerly winds will be blowing at strong velocity at high altitudes reach 50 km/hr. At 1000m: +16 degrees; 2000m: +5 degrees. Source: GeoSphere Austria

avalancheActivity.comment: Wet-snow avalanches possible at any time or day or night, due to a thoroughly wet snowpack following a night of overcast skies., esp. at the foot of rock walls on the Italian border. Wet-snow avalanches can fracture down to ground level and grow to medium size, esp. in zones with sufficient snow. Runout zones should be avoided. Freshly generated snowdrift accumulations can often be triggered by one sole skier, esp. on very steep shady slopes above 2800m. Such danger zones occur in ridgeline terrain, in gullies and bowls. These are unfavorable conditions for backcountry tours.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Due to rainfall, wet-snow avalanches possible at any time or day or night. Fresh snowdrifts in high-alpine zones.

snowpackStructure.comment: Rainfall expected up to high altitudes. Weather conditions below 2800m are leading to the snowpack becoming thoroughly wet. Following a night of overcast skies, reduced outgoing radiation and the snowpack surface can freeze only superficially, it softens swiftly in the morning. Weather conditions are making the snowpack ever wetter, leading to a loss of firmness inside the snowpack. High-alpine regions: 10-20cm of fresh snowfall anticipated, locally more. Due to fresh fallen snow and often strong southerly winds, small new snowdrift accumulations will be generated.

tendency.highlights: Due to rainfall, frequency and size of danger zones are on the increase

weatherForecast.comment: On Wednesday, gray and wet weather anticipated. Dense clouds will accumulate. A bit of rainfall is anticipated. Southerly winds will be blowing at strong velocity at high altitudes reach 50 km/hr. At 1000m: +16 degrees; 2000m: +5 degrees. Source: GeoSphere Austria

avalancheActivity.comment: Due to daytime warming and solar radiation, likelihood of wet snow slides possible at any time of day or night. Runout zones should be avoided. Unfavorable conditions for backcountry tours.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Due to rainfall, wet-snow slides possible at any time or day or night.

snowpackStructure.comment: Rainfall is anticipated. Weather conditions are making the snowpack thoroughly wet, leading to a loss of firmness inside the snowpack.

weatherForecast.comment: On Wednesday, gray and wet weather anticipated. Dense clouds will accumulate. A bit of rainfall is anticipated, esp. in Upper Carinthia’s mountains. From Gurktal Alps eastewards it will remain mostly dry, a few sunny intervals can be expected, in places the summits will be in the clear. Southerly winds will be blowing at strong velocity at high altitudes reach 50 km/hr. At 1000m: +16 degrees; 2000m: +5 degrees. Source: GeoSphere Austria

customData.generalHeadline: Unfavorable avalanche situation. Wet-snow is the major danger.
